title: Pulsed Electroluminescence in a Dopant-free Gateable Semiconductor
authors:
S. R. Harrigan, F. Sfigakis, L. Tian, N. Sherlekar, B. Cunard, M. C.
  Tam, H.-S. Kim, Z. Wasilewski, M. E. Reimer, J. Baugh
abstract:
We report on a stable form of pulsed electroluminescence in a dopant-free
direct bandgap semiconductor heterostructure that we coin the tidal effect.
Swapping an inducing gate voltage in an ambipolar field effect transistor
allows incoming and outgoing carriers of opposite charge to meet and recombine
radiatively. We develop a model to explain the carrier dynamics that underpins
the frequency response of the pulsed electroluminesence intensity. Higher
mobilities enable larger active emission areas than previous reports, as well
as stable emission over long timescales.
